channel.title: cooking on Brain Baking
channel.description: Recent content in cooking on Brain Baking

item.title: Nuts about local nuts
item.author: wouter.groeneveld@gmail.com (Wouter Groeneveld)
item.description: Remembering David Lebovitz’ pine nut syndrome, I started to take a closer look at packages of food we buy at the local supermarket. It’s so easy to get completely focused on buying local vegetables but forgetting to look at the label when throwing something like pine nuts into the shopping cart. The worst thing is, most supermarkets don’t care and don’t offer an alternative. However, let’s not panic just yet: this is slowly changing (but reached a plateau).

item.title: Development principles in cooking
item.author: wouter.groeneveld@gmail.com (Wouter Groeneveld)
item.description: A lot of people seem to think I’m the kind of chef who uses loads and loads of ingredients, combining and layering without thinking twice. We were having a discussion about what to cook for dinner this evening. It’s ‘donderdag veggiedag’, an initiative from the Belgian EVA VZW to eat a vegetarian meal each thursday, and since I’m a vegetarian, it’s generally accepted that I should know a lot of good recipes.
